title: ijeb
author: ijeb
content: Hello everyone!A while ago I discovered some betting projects based on the blockchain technology and BetterFan seem to be among the best, or at least I think so.Wanted to see your opinion on BetterFan as well. What do you think? Coinmarketcap: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/better-for-fans

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: This is not the first time I have seen the smartcontract-hosted betting mechanism, maybe this platform will be enriched with more varied sports betting options and allow several types of betting assets or it will be limited to using only their own tokens.Something interesting in the FAQ section.Quote from: https://better.fan/Better Fan is a predict-to-earn game based on real sports events. We allow users to place their predictions on sports events without any financial risk, our target audience includes all sports fans, gamers, and individuals who suffer from gambling addiction. A guarantee that seem exaggerated to comfort players, there have been a number of cases of smart contract exploits in the past despite the developer claiming to have used verified auditors. Then I wouldn't take that jargon as an excuse to play on this platform worry-free.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Well the very first dice game was actually on chain. It wasnâ€™t on Ethereum but it was on Bitcoin blockchain. The hash was used as the result so you knew it was provably fair. This was when fees were crazy cheap. I think the base fee was like 1000 sats but Bitcoin was maybe $50 back then so this was an ultra low fee.Then it eventually had a website because the fees increased and you could bet faster with a user interface. So this is nothing new but playing from a centralized UI just seems better for most players.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I've never heard of BetterFan to be honest, but I think network-based games like this will flourish after the Taproot upgrade, where Ordinals and NFT are now possible on the Bitcoin blockchain.See this for example:QuoteOrdinals' Bitcoin NFTs are evolving, advancing from pixelated memes and pet rocks to a playable DOOM clone in a matter of dayshttps://blockworks.co/news/play-doom-bitcoin

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: ijeb on May 23, 2023, 12:08:11 AMA while ago I discovered some betting projects based on the blockchain technology and BetterFan seem to be among the best, or at least I think so.Wanted to see your opinion on BetterFan as well. What do you think? Just reading about the description on CMC makes me want to stay away from this token.They keep using the word "betting" and then they also claim it's not gambling. They want to call it "predict to earn" instead which I think is pure BS. I'm guessing nobody is going to lose anything if they make the wrong prediction but the question is where will the rewards come from? I bet it will come from thin air - minted in advance tokens. They entice the people to buy by offering a higher betting limit but what happens next if nobody wants that?I think this is one of those too good to be true projects.
